conclusion: Determine the work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A.
From the p-V diagram, the process from C to A is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
At state C, the pressure \( p_C = 1 \times 10^5 \) Pa and the volume \( V_C = 5 \) L. At state A, the pressure \( p_A = 1 \times 10^5 \) Pa and the volume \( V_A = 2 \) L.
Calculate the work done during an isobaric process using \( W = p \Delta V = p (V_A - V_C) \).
Substitute the values to find \( W = 1 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \times (-3 \, \text{L}) \).
Convert liters to cubic meters and calculate \( W = 1 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \times (-3 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3) = -300 \, \text{J} \).
Interpret the negative sign as work done by the gas on the surroundings, so the work done by the external environment is the opposite.
The work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A is \( 300 \, \text{J} \).
